topics.title: Compound
topics.details: This chapter explains how compound works

explanations.details:
Compound is one of the first DeFi platforms in the DeFi space. Like other DeFi lending and borrowing platforms, users in Compound can Lend asserts to earn interest and can also borrow by having a over collateralized position. 

Compound recently released their version three of the protocol, also Called "Compound III". and it is quite different from V2.

A very key difference in supplying assets in Compound V2 and V3 is that as of Compound V3, only one of the assets supplied by the user is eligible to earn interest as per the supply APY of that asset. This asset is called base token and it will not be used as collateral. All other assets supplied by the user will be considered as collateral and interest will not be accrued by these assets. Also, cTokens are no longer used by the protocol.
explanations.title: About Compound

explanations.details:
The COMP token allows users to participate in the governance of the Compound protocol. COMP token-holders and their delegates debate, propose and vote on all changes to the protocol. 

This system empowers the community to govern the Compound protocol and ensures that those who use the protocol have a say in its future. The daily distribution of COMP tokens ensures that users are incentivized to participate in good governance.

Each day, approximately 1,234 COMP are distributed to users of the protocol; the distribution is allocated to each market (ETH, USDC, DAIâ€¦), and is set through the governance process by COMP token-holders.

Within each market, half of the COMP tokens are earned by suppliers and the other half by borrowers. When users use Compound to supply or borrow assets, they automatically start accruing COMP. 

COMP can only be claimed by addresses that interact with the protocol and are able to call the claim function.
